issues.title: class properties disappear if assigned a var that has no value assigned
php json_decode ($ str, 1) isset is invalid after passing to zephir
issues.body:
post data: ``` rows:[{"item_id":1,"parent_id":null,"depth":1,"left":1,"right":10}, {"id":"59818f067e52392064000042","parent_id":1,"depth":1,"left":2,"right":3}, {"id":"59818f607e52392064000047","parent_id":1,"depth":1,"left":4,"right":5}, {"id":"59a26e607e52391c180035d2","parent_id":1,"depth":1,"left":6,"right":9}, {"id":"59818f867e523921ec00733c","parent_id":"59a26e607e52391c180035d2","depth":2,"left":7,"right":8}] ``` php code ```php $rows=$this->request->getPost('rows'); $rows=json_decode($rows,true); var_export(rows); \XqKeji\Test::change($rows); ``` output data: ```php array ( 0 => array ( 'item_id' => 1, 'parent_id' => NULL, 'depth' => 1, 'left' => 1, 'right' => 10, ), 1 => array ( 'id' => '59818f067e52392064000042', 'parent_id' => 1, 'depth' => 1, 'left' => 2, 'right' => 3, ), 2 => array ( 'id' => '59818f607e52392064000047', 'parent_id' => 1, 'depth' => 1, 'left' => 4, 'right' => 5, ), 3 => array ( 'id' => '59a26e607e52391c180035d2', 'parent_id' => 1, 'depth' => 1, 'left' => 6, 'right' => 9, ), 4 => array ( 'id' => '59818f867e523921ec00733c', 'parent_id' => '59a26e607e52391c180035d2', 'depth' => 2, 'left' => 7, 'right' => 8, ), ) ```

zephir code

```zep namespace XqKeji; class Test { public static function change(array data=[]) { var row; for row in data { var_export(row); if isset row["parent_id"] { echo "exits parent_id"; } } } } ```

output data:

```php array ( 'item_id' => 1, 'parent_id' => NULL, 'depth' => 1, 'left' => 1, 'right' => 10, ) array ( 'id' => '59818f067e52392064000042', 'parent_id' => 1, 'depth' => 1, 'left' => 2, 'right' => 3, ) array ( 'id' => '59818f607e52392064000047', 'parent_id' => 1, 'depth' => 1, 'left' => 4, 'right' => 5, ) array ( 'id' => '59a26e607e52391c180035d2', 'parent_id' => 1, 'depth' => 1, 'left' => 6, 'right' => 9, ) array ( 'id' => '59818f867e523921ec00733c', 'parent_id' => '59a26e607e52391c180035d2', 'depth' => 2, 'left' => 7, 'right' => 8, ) ```

change the zephir code

```zep namespace XqKeji; class Test { public static function change(array data=[]) { var row; for row in data { let row = json_decode(json_encode(row),1); var_export(row); if isset row["parent_id"] { echo "exits parent_id"; } } } } ``` ```php array ( 'item_id' => 1, 'parent_id' => NULL, 'depth' => 1, 'left' => 1, 'right' => 10, )exits parent_id array ( 'id' => '59818f067e52392064000042', 'parent_id' => 1, 'depth' => 1, 'left' => 2, 'right' => 3, )exits parent_id array ( 'id' => '59818f607e52392064000047', 'parent_id' => 1, 'depth' => 1, 'left' => 4, 'right' => 5, )exits parent_id array ( 'id' => '59a26e607e52391c180035d2', 'parent_id' => 1, 'depth' => 1, 'left' => 6, 'right' => 9, )exits parent_id array ( 'id' => '59818f867e523921ec00733c', 'parent_id' => '59a26e607e52391c180035d2', 'depth' => 2, 'left' => 7, 'right' => 8, )exits parent_id ``` I use `json_encode` and `json_decode` the test is valid. php7.0.15 nts zephir 0.10.6 win 10

issues.title: [BUG] Assignment to protected static property derived from Phalcon class causes segmentation fault
issues.body:
More about an issue [here](https://forum.phalconphp.com/discussion/17219/why-assigning-to-a-static-property-causes-random-segmentation-fa#C52027).

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create new project using cli.
2. Create a simple class in library folder, that extends `\Phalcon\Tag`
```php
class Tag extends \Phalcon\Tag
{
    public static function getUrlService()
    {
        self::$_escaperService = new \stdClass(); // <- this or any other assignment to any static property causes an error

        return parent::getUrlService();
    }
}
```
3. Call `Tag::getUrlService();` anywhere, in my case inside `IndexController::indexAction`.
4. Use php build-in web server and refresh page a few times.
```
╭─klatosinski@workstation ~/Code/test

zend_mm_heap corrupted

I'm trying to run an application on Centos7, under PHP7.1 and Phalcon 3.3.x.

I'm seeing extremely unstable behaviour which results in segfaults in phalcon.so:

i.e. [Zephir](https://github.com/phalcon/cphalcon/blob/master/phalcon/config.zep#L55)

class Config implements \ArrayAccess, \Countable {

issues.title: Extending class with static is changing null value
Access to undeclared static property
Casting resource to int
issues.body:
Hi,

Found an unexpected result when casting resources to ints (common thing in PHP):

```
    var key;
    let key =  (int) stream; //stream is resource #127
    echo $key;
```

Expected:
`127`
Current:
`1`

I always receive `1` instead of resource id. `intval` is also not working. `strval` gets `Resource id #127`

issues.title: Detect debug when building
issues.body:
I have a small idea, sometimes i forgot to write builddev when i need to, how about:

- if yes then `zephir build` will always build extension with debug symbols(just `zephir builddev`)
- if not then as it is
- add `zephir buildprod` so someone can build extension without debug symbols anyway

issues.title: [RFC] FastCall API
issues.body:
Currently, Zephir compiler misses a lot of cases where method caching could save some time. Some of these misses are by design (i.e., when a non-final method is called, the compiler cannot be sure which class `$this` refers to), some are compiler defects (when the same method is called in a loop).

Some of these deficiencies are dealt with by the Zephir Kernel (it tries to cache functions and methods called by the user code). However, this caching is not very efficient: a) every method/function is cached, b) cache is stored in hash tables.

FastCall API can be used to deal with these deficiencies; however, *right now* it is quite low-level and is for manual use only.

[Usage example](https://github.com/sjinks/zephir/commit/c360d861dcb2585431ae53fe9483e1f87f6600cb#diff-b913b909037a897c48b0d7f9e284dcf2R141)

[Benchmarks](https://travis-ci.org/sjinks/zephir/jobs/222133655#L4901)

PS: `fastcall` branch was branched off `master` and does not include fixes from #1509.

However, my initial impression is that it could be faster than our current CALL API.

The main question is: do we need it? :-)

@sergeyklay @Jurigag @ovr

commit.message: Code cleanup, removed no longer used variables

ZE3: Fixed adding reference counter for scalar values

PHP doesn't allocate scalar values in heap but do it directly on VM
stack, inside HashTables and object. They are not subjects for
reference counting and garbage collection anymore. Scalar values
don't have reference counter and don't support Z_ADDREF*(), Z_DELREF*(),
Z_REFCOUNT*() and Z_SET_REFCOUNT*() macros anymore. In most cases we
should check if zval supports these macros before calling them.
Otherwise we'll get an assert() or crash.
Minor fixes for SymbolTable (CS, comparing objects, PHPDoc)

Start our application 1000 runs

cd ext

Hi there,

Thanks for the feedback and questions.

What the ./install script is doing with my mod is to simply install zephir in /usr/local/bin, which should be in your path. the /usr/local/bin/zephir script knows where to find zephir, no need for environment variables.
Therefore, you can just type commands as such:

cd /where/ever
zephir init myext
cd /where/ever/myext
<write code here>
zephir generate
zephir compile
zephir install

With all your code in /where/ever/myext, the extension will be built into /where/ever/myext/ext.
Good idea using basename(getcwd()) as default namespace.

Decoupling zephir itself from the extension you're building is much easier - try building a new extension as it stands, it's hard :-)

@mobli Just like npm / composer do, NOT everybody happy to install it to /usr/local/bin.

So with origin zephir shell script it will auto detect ZEPHIRDIR enviroment is set? 
If set , using user's ZEPHIRDIR (Like yours).
If not set, using the current shell script's parent path.

It's behavior like yours, but more flexible. right?

And you are welcome.

It doesn't really matter to me how it's done, as long as I can decouple zephir from the work I'm doing now.
So for instance, I might install zephir in /opt but work in ~/projects. I don't want to have to change my .profile file every time I add a new tool, which is what I need to do to make ZEPHIRDIR sticky.
I can the mods as you requested so as not to install zephir in /usr/local/bin because I really need that pull request to go through, but I'd prefer if you could reconsider your position on that. Please let me know ;-)

Thanks
@racklin I've restored the install process as you requested. I've simply added an option on the install script that will copy zephir to /usr/local/bin for those who want (like me :-).
